resources.string: More information can be found on:
The app uses MPAndroidChart from Philipp Jahoda (Apache 2 License).
This application belongs to the Privacy Friendly Apps group developed by Technische Universit√§t Darmstadt. Sourcecode licensed under GPLv3. Images copyright TU Darmstadt and Google Inc.
Please provide a new number of steps you walked.

This app can count your steps in background, provides you an overview about your walked steps and allows you to define custom walking modes and notifications if the achievement of your daily step goal is in danger.
The step counter counts your daily steps in background and can be disabled in the settings.
The permanent notification is necessary to keep the step counter alive in background. The content of the notification can be chosen in the settings.
You can disable all notifications in system preferences.
The app can show you motivation alerts if the achievement of your daily step goal is in danger. You can define the criterion, the time of day and the notification texts.
is used to start the step counter and set the notifications at boot time. If the permission is not granted you have to start the app manually once after boot to activate the app.
The permissions used by Privacy Friendly Pedometer can not be managed by the user in any Android version.
is used to keep the CPU awake to count the steps in background.
is used to show your current walking speed on home screen. If the permission is not granted the walking speed will not be showed - there are no other implications.
The app counts your steps in background.
On some devices the processor falls asleep and prevents counting steps. Enable this to keep the processor awake while counting steps - this may drain your battery!
For better results during training mode keep processor awake. If app should keep the processor awake at any time this is automatically the case.
The app shows your current velocity in daily report. Access to your location is required to calculate the exact velocity.
To improve the calculation of the calories please set your weight and gender.
The permanent notification is shown when the app counts your steps in background. You can customize what the app should show you.
The app uses the accelerometer of your device. To optimize the step detection adjust the sensitivity, please.
Show number of steps walked today

string-array.name: pref_keys_notification_motivation_alert_criterion
string-array.item: less than 90％ of daily step goal
less than 70％ of daily step goal
less than 50％ of daily step goal

resources.string: Privacy Friendly Pedometer can count your steps in background and provides an overview about walked steps.
To improve the calculation of the calories you have burned by walking please customize your personal settings.
You can switch your current walking modes using the context menu in the toolbar.
Add a widget to your homescreen to stay up to date about your walked steps.

string-array.name: pref_default_notification_motivation_alert_messages
string-array.item: Come on, it\'s time to walk!

resources.string: Set custom alert messages when the achievement of your daily step goal is in danger.\n\nThere will be no alert if no message exists.
Set your own custom motivation alert. The app notifies you with one of your texts randomly.
Empty motivation alerts are useless, aren\'t they?
At least one walking mode is required.
Cannot delete an active walking mode.
The application can learn the distance per step. Please walk the given distance and press end if you finished.
Name and step length are required. Please fill in!
It seems like you didn\'t used the training functionality, yet. It\'s time to start your training!

The app detects your steps based on different algorithms. On some devices you can define the sensivity of step detection in settings. In addition to that you can add steps you walked without the app or correct the stepcount on daily activity chart.
Define custom walking modes and notifications if the achievement of your daily step goal is in danger.
In the settings you can define your own walking modes with different step lengths.
You can define your own walking modes like \'Running\' or \'Walking\' in the preferences. Each walking mode has its own step length.
The training sessions can be used to track your training performance. Each session tracks e.g. the training duration, the walked steps and distance.

The distance measurement feature allows you to measure the distance between the button press \'Start\' and \'Stop\'. The data will not be stored after app restarts. To persist the data you can use the training sessions.
You can modify the detected daily steps in daily report view. This allows you to add steps you walked without the app or to correct the detected number of steps.
Click on \'Preferences\' to set your step size and customize your personal data.
Keep an eye on your blood pressure
Check your heart rate throughout the day
Record your water intake every day.
Stay on top of your weight
Can\'t enter a time earlier than the current time.
Make goals to stay on track.
You are %1$.1f kg closer to your goal!
You still need to gain %1$.1f kg
You still need to lose %1$.1f kg
Target reached! Keep going and set a new target.

Body mass index (BMI) is your weight in kilograms divided by the square of your height in meters. For example, an adult who\'s 1.75 meters tall and weights 70 kilograms will have a BMI of 22.9. The healthy range for you will depend on your age, gender, and muscle mass.

The body fat percentage is the amount of body fat as a proportion of body weight. This can tell you more about your body\'s fat and lean body mass. The body fat percentage can be determined by a number of methods. The percentage of body fat in an individual varies depending on sex, age, height and weight.
Mean range of body fat percentage

The body fat requirements for men and women are different.\n\n A healthcare professional should always be consulted to measure your body fat percentage and to suggest methods to help you keep your body fat under control.
Input error, low pressure value cannot be greater than high pressure value

Blood pressure is the force of blood flow pushing against your artery walls. Systolic refers to blood pressure when the heart beats while pumping blood. Diastolic refers to blood pressure when the heart is at rest between beats.

 Measurements less than 120/80 mmHg are generally considered to be within the normal range for adults aged 20 or over.

 Tracking blood pressure at home is important for those who have high blood pressure. When you track blood pressure at home on a regular basis, try to check at the same time of day for more consistent readings. Avoid cigarettes and exercise for at least 30 minutes before checking your blood pressure.
Camera permission is required for measuring heart rate.
Try to stay still and quiet
Check that your finger is on the camera
Place your finger on the camera
Rest for 10 minutes first for more accurate results.
Keep track of how much water you drink. One glass is 250ml
Good health starts with staying hydrated!
Set a daily water intake target to stay on track. One glass is 250 ml.
Start time must be earlier than end time, as calculated based on workout duration.

SWOLF is a way of measuring your swimming efficiency. It is calculated per length (ideally in a 50m swimming pool) by comparing the length of time it took you to swim the length with the number of strokes it took you to swim it. The smaller the value, the higher the efficiency.
Wait until your next period to record your symptoms
Record your period to generate data
Data older than 180 days cannot be modified
Period length cannot exceed the set cycle length.
Your period cycle seems too short.
Note: Cycle Calendar uses algorithms to predict the next period and fertile window based on information recorded by the users. This data (period and cycle length) is just for reference.
Hold and drag the icons on the left to change the order.
Menstruation is also known as periods, are the regular discharge of blood and tissue from the inner lining of the uterus
Periods usually happen every month and can last for 2 to 7 days. The average period is between 3 and 5 days long.
The fertile window spans from 5 days before ovulation to 4 days after ovulation, for about 10 days total. During this window there is a higher probability of pregnancy.

Periods (menstruation) are part of the menstrual cycle. The period refers to the part of the cycle when the body discharges blood and tissue from the inner lining of the uterus. A cycle is from the first day of the period to the first day of the next period. Cycles become more regular after the first 5 to 7 years.
How long is the average cycle?

The length varies by person. The average length is 28 days. Periods usually don\'t come exactly on time and it is normal for them to start 7 days early or late. Periods can last for 2 to 7 days and the average period is 3 to 5 days long.

The menstrual cycle is made up of phases. The phases are divided by two events, the ovarian cycle and the uterine cycle. The ovarian cycle is the follicular phase, ovulation, and the luteal phase. The uterine cycle is menstruation, the proliferative phase, and the secretory phase.
Note: Ovulation is not considered a stage, but the event that divides the phases.

 In a general sense, the follicular phase starts the first day of the period and ends the day of ovulation. The period is the early part of the follicular phase. Follicles start maturing during the period. The main event of the follicular phase happens after the bleeding ends. During this time more estrogen is produced and the uterus is prepared for possible fertilization. There is no secretion during this time. Ovulation marks the end of this phase, and the beginning of the next.

 The day of ovulation, the egg is released. Under standard circumstances, the next ovulation will take place about 14 to 16 days after the next period starts. The chances of pregnancy are highest 5 days before ovulation, this period is called the fertile window.

 The stage after ovulation is called the luteal phase. The ovaries are stimulated by hormones, luteinizing hormones are secreted. If fertilization didn't occur the thickened uterus walls will collapse, starting the period. This indicates the end of the current cycle and the start of the next cycle.
Predictions are based on the individual\'s data(including the average length of their period and cycle). Reminders are sent based on this data to help keep track of the menstrual cycle.
Your phone\'s motion sensor is used to record your running data. For improved data accuracy, please attach the phone to your arm.
Touch and hold the end button to exit
You haven\'t covered enough ground to create a record. End workout?
It is set to running mode
It is set to walking mode
